dlgLine.text: I was expecting you'd show up.
I trust you heard about the reactor? I steered a guy over in your direction - guessing he got there.
So... you need to get your people out and you need our help, right?
You've helped us out in the past. And since we're making preparations to pull out of here as well, it might be possible.
However, between the militia raids, infections, and illness, my company needs all the good people it can get. So... I have a proposition for you and I really want you to think about it...

You've proven that you can lead and that you can handle whatever this world we're now living in can throw at you. I need a new second-in-command. So... if you agree to join me - work with me - I'll fly your people - all your people - out of the fallout zone.
Will you do it?

dlgAnsw.text: I need time to think about this.
For the safety of my people... I'll do it.
I'm kind of used to being in charge...
I don't know how much fight I have left in me.

dlgLine.text: Don't take too long. I'll be here when you're ready.
I knew I could count on you.
I'll start getting the birds prepped. I'll radio your shelter and let them know we're coming. And.. I'll make sure that you have some time to say goodbye.
There's plenty of responsibility to go around. That's why I asked you.

dlgAnsw.text: I need time to think about this.

dlgLine.text: Think about it.
Hey! Good to see you.
I was expecting you'd show up.
I trust you heard about the reactor? I steered a guy over in your direction - guessing he got there.
So... you need to get your people out and you need our help, right?

dlgAnsw.text: You owe me for Paul. Took my best guy.

dlgLine.text: You've helped us out in the past. And since we're making preparations to pull out of here as well, it might be possible.
I talked to the Lieutenant and I think we can get you out of here. But we have a request. I'm not sure how how you're going to take it.

You've proven that you can lead and that you can handle whatever this world we're now living in can throw at you. I need a new second-in-command. So... if you agree to join me - work with me - I'll fly your people - all your people - out of the fallout zone.
We need good people if we're going to make a difference out there. It's not going to be easy, but I believe in what this group is doing.
Will you do it?

dlgAnsw.text: I need time to think about this.
For the safety of my people... I'll do it.
I'm kind of used to being in charge...
I don't know how much fight I have left in me.

dlgLine.text: So.. have you thought it over? Will you join my company?

dlgAnsw.text: I need time to think about this.
For the safety of my people... I'll do it.

dlgLine.text: <After a few hours, a military convoy containing your allies from the shelter shows up.>
Your people are all here. We'll be ready to takeoff in a few minutes, if you want to say your goodbyes.

dlgAnsw.checkOnAppear: isCharInShelter(1004) == True && isCharInShelter(1031) == True && isCharInShelter(1032) == True

dlgLine.text: Hey, <charname>, I know I haven't been as useful as everyone else, but I just want you to know you made me feel like I was making a difference, which is why I became an officer in the first place. Thanks for keeping us safe all those days and nights. I'm really going to miss you.
Also, in case I don't see you again, here's the picture Davis took of me back in our first week. So glad it didn't end up on that Memorial Wall, I tell you what.
Well... I should get going. You take care of yourself, okay?

dlgAnsw.checkOnAppear: isCharInShelter(1004) == True && isCharInShelter(1031) == True && isCharInShelter(1032) == True

dlgLine.text: Hey... I probably didn't say this enough, but thank you for keeping my mom and I safe all these months. I'll never forget what you did for us. <Renee hugs you tightly>
You kept my Renee safe - for that, you have my eternal gratitude. Wherever you end up, know that you'll always be in my prayers.

dlgAnsw.checkOnAppear: isCharInShelter(1004) == True && isCharInShelter(1031) == True && isCharInShelter(1032) == True

dlgLine.text: I owe you my life. But more than that, you helped me forgive myself. I promise you - in your absence, I will do everything I can to keep these people alive. You have my word.
You stay alive, okay? I need to know there are people like you out there making a difference. It's the only way we have a chance of going back to the way things used to be.

dlgAnsw.checkOnAppear: isCharInShelter(1004) == True && isCharInShelter(1031) == True && isCharInShelter(1032) == True

dlgLine.text: Hey... I know it hasn't been easy keeping Melina alive, but every day I have with her is due to you. And then you go and do something like this for us and you make it even harder to say goodbye.
We're grateful for your help. Wherever you go after this, know that we'll always be thinking about you. Take care of yourself. <Oscar hugs you.>

dlgAnsw.checkOnAppear: isCharInShelter(1004) == True && isCharInShelter(1031) == True && isCharInShelter(1032) == True

dlgLine.text: Hey there... I'm going to spare you all the heartfelt bullshit and just shake your hand. Ryan and Michiru are going to get out of here just fine, and that's all I care about.
You stay well, alright? Oh, and I made you something for the road. It's better off if you don't think about what's in it - just eat it.
I just want to thank you for what you're doing. This is quite a sacrifice you're making, and I can't say I'd do the same.

I know I might have been a thorn in your side sometimes, but you did a great job leading this group. Going to take a lot of stepping up from everyone to keep it together, but we'll get it done. Good luck to you - I mean that.
Well... I guess this where we say goodbye. 'Fore I go, I think I should warn you about something.

All those people we had to kill - self-defense or not - it's gonna weigh you down. You'll see their faces when you close your eyes, feel that moment over and over, trying to think of what else you could've done. I know it - I've lived with one in particular for years.

I just want to tell you that there's going to be times where you're not going to be able to forgive yourself. Those demons will drag you down, I tell you what. But, ultimately, you'll have days where you can make a real difference in the lives of others. We have a responsibility to those moments. Make it right when you can - that's all we can do.
Anyhow... it's not going to be easy without you, but I'll do my best to keep everyone in line. <charname>... you take care of yourself, you hear me?

Well... I guess this is where we say goodbye. Thank you for everything you did. I know many of those decisions were't easy, and it was more than most people could handle. I suppose I'm going to have to step up even more in your absence, and to be honest, I'd rather you were coming along.
Be careful out there, making the world whole again. There aren't many people that could do it, but I think the odds are a little better, knowing you're out there working on it.
We'll never forget what you did for us - in Splendid or what you're doing today. If you don't see me again, I want to know, you will always have my respect.
Sorry to have to cut the goodbyes short, but we're ready to move your people out. Come on - you can see them off from the helipad.

dlgAnsw.text: <You follow Adair out of his office.>
